result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Myers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with Mindy M. unless probation agent approves.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant shall provide DNA sample.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath or urine.

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty. John A Best.  Atty. Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Agreement reached; State moves to amend Ct. 1 to two counts of Misd. Battery pursuant to sec. 940.19(1) and Court so orders; State further moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 and Court so orders.   Guilty plea entered on amended Cts. 1 and 2.  Court finds Defendant guilty on amended Cts. 1 and 2.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.   Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
